snippet: The new National African American Museum for History and Culture has acquired two relics of the Angola penitentiary in Louisiana, which has historical roots in slavery.
abstract: National African American Museum for History and Culture in Washington DC will install an old guard tower and cell from Louisiana State Penitentiary, also known as Angola, prison that has historical roots in slavery.
lead_paragraph: The new National African American Museum for History and Culture has acquired two relics of the Angola penitentiary in Louisiana, which has historical roots in slavery.

headline.seo: Relics From Angola Are to Tell Black History at New Museum
headline.main: Tower and Cell, Signifying Much More Than a Prison
headline.print_headline: Tower and Cell, Signifying Much More Than a Prison

keywords.value: National African American Museum for History and Culture
